keyTakeAways: Lance Bass has type 1.5 diabetes, also known as latent autoimmune diabetes (LADA).
He uses the Dexcom G7 Continuous Glucose Monitoring System to track his blood sugar levels effectively.
Bass created an online persona called 'Blood Sugar Lance' to educate the public about diabetes with humor, which developed accidentally on Instagram.
He identifies white rice and white bread as foods that significantly spike his blood sugar, even with small amounts.
His uncle had type 1 diabetes, which influenced his early awareness of diabetes-related dietary restrictions.
He highlights how advancements in monitoring technology and support from the diabetic community have improved his quality of life.
Stress from his high-profile career and parenting responsibilities (raising four-year-old twins Violet and Alexander) affects his blood sugar levels.
Bass has no current plans for an *NSYNC reunion tour, stating he does not have any breaking news on the subject.
He expresses skepticism about media reports suggesting a potential *NSYNC reunion, calling them inaccurate and misleading.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Lance Bass, former member of *NSYNC, shares insights into his personal experience living with type 1.5 diabetes (LADA), emphasizing how continuous glucose monitoring via the Dexcom G7 system has transformed his daily management. He created the online persona 'Blood Sugar Lance' to educate and entertain followers about diabetes with humor. Bass explains that foods like white rice and white bread significantly spike his blood sugar, and he notes the emotional and physical toll of managing diabetes alongside parenting his twin children. Despite widespread fan interest in a potential *NSYNC reunion, Bass confirms there are no current plans and dismisses media reports as inaccurate. This article highlights both personal health advocacy and the intersection of celebrity life with chronic illness management.
title: Lance Bass Has More to Say About Living with Diabetes Than He Does About an *NSYNC Reunion
